newsitem.title: DUBAI: MAS may reroute cargo to save fuel.
newsitem.headline: MAS may reroute cargo to save fuel.

text.p: Malaysian Airlines Cargo is continually looking at ways of reducing fuel costs including rerouting flights, the carrier's general manager cargo sales, J.J.Ong said.

"We are for instance looking at using Sharjah, instead of Dubai, for the refuelling of our Kuala Lumpur-Amsterdam freighters. Sharjah is a cheaper place to buy fuel but we also have other commercial considerations to take into account," he said at the 18th Air Cargo Forum here on Tuesday.
"Also flying to North America, we normally refuel at Anchorage, but we have been considering Khabarovsk in Siberia. But support services do have to be considered."

"We're looking at adjusting routes to get the best possible benefits," he said. Ong told Reuters that air cargo rates from Malaysia to the U.S. were "almost double" those from the U.S., while those from Kuala Lumpur to Europe were on average 20 to 25 percent higher - depending on the exact route - than the price charged on the return leg.
